author: Michael Larabel
description: Linux 6.18 stable is now available! Linux 6.18 ushers in many new features and changes while also is expected to become this year's Long Term Support "LTS" kernel version...
title: Linux 6.18 Released With Many New Features, Likely This Year's LTS Kernel

author: Michael Larabel
description: With the Linux 6.18 kernel likely being released later today, here is a look at some of the features on the table for the next kernel cycle, Linux 6.19. The list is based on changes queued in various "-next" branches ahead of the Linux 6.19 merge window. There's always the possibility of last minute change of plans or objections raised by Linus Torvalds, but this should provide an early look at some of the features more than likely to be merged for Linux 6.19...
title: Features Expected For Linux 6.19: ASUS Armoury, Many Intel Bits, AMD GCN 1.0/1.1 Enhanced

author: Michael Larabel
description: Ahead of the FreeBSD 15.0 stable release expected to be announced next week, the FreeBSD project today published their Q3-2025 status report to outline their various development accomplishments from July through September...
title: Sylve Maturing As A FreeBSD Unified Web Management Interface

author: Michael Larabel
description: With the upcoming Linux 6.19 kernel cycle there are yet more Rust kernel bindings being introduced and other additions to make it possible to write more Linux kernel drivers within the Rust programming language. Among the new Rust additions expected for Linux 6.19 are making it possible to write Inter-Integrated Circuit (I2C) bus drivers in Rust...
title: Linux 6.19 Will Allow You To Write I2C Drivers In Rust

author: Michael Larabel
description: Queued up via the Linux kernel's RDMA development Git tree is "BNG_RE" as the next-generation RoCE driver from Broadcom...
title: Broadcom "BNG_RE" Next-Generation RoCE Driver Slated For Linux 6.19

author: Michael Larabel
description: A new SoC vendor and in turn new SoC/platform support is set to premiere in the Linux 6.19 kernel with the initial Black Sesame Technologies C1200 support...
title: Black Sesame SoC Support To Be Merged For Linux 6.19

author: Michael Larabel
description: The Genode OS Framework 25.11 release was issued this weekend as the newest update to this original open-source operating system effort built around a micro-kernel design and various novel design approaches...
title: Genode OS Framework 25.11 Adds Intel Alder Lake Graphics Support
